links.quantification: Tradeable rights → farmers sell 30% extraction quota → ₹15K/ha revenue → crop diversification from rice (4000L/kg) to pulses (900L/kg) → 60% water savings
Reduced pumping → 30% lower groundwater extraction → 20 TWh/year pump energy saved → ₹12K Cr subsidy reduction → fiscal space freed
Recharge credits → cities invest ₹5K Cr in managed aquifer recharge → urban water security improves → 500M m³/year recharge achieved
Market pricing → industrial water costs ₹50/m³ (vs. ₹5/m³ unregulated) → 40% recycling adoption → freshwater demand reduction
Farmer resistance: Rights cap limits extraction → perceived livelihood threat → political opposition in Punjab/Haryana → 5-year implementation delay
Equity concerns: Large farmers buy rights from small holders → concentration of water access → 30% smallholders exit agriculture → rural displacement
Aquifer recovery → water tables rise 5m → wetland revival → migratory bird populations +40% → ecosystem health cascade (reinforcing)
Requires metering infrastructure: Markets only work with 100% extraction monitoring → ₹10K Cr smart meter installation prerequisite
Via crop shift: Rice → pulses → 60% irrigation reduction → 12 TWh pump energy saved → grid capacity freed for RE integration
Via recharge: Urban MAR → aquifer recovery → rural well revival → community water security improves → urban-rural solidarity
Via recycling: Industrial water reuse → municipal supply pressure reduced → ₹3K Cr infrastructure investment avoided
